text.0: whomso ye rescue here and there whomso ye guide o deities.
text.1: to him give shelter agni mitra varuṇa ye maruts and thou aryaman.
text.2: through your kind favour gods on some auspicious day the worshipper subdues his foes.
text.3: that man increases home and strengthening ample food who brings you offerings as ye list.
text.4: vasiṣṭha will not overlook the lowliest one among you all.
text.5: o maruts of our soma juice effused today drink all of you with eager haste.
text.6: your succour in the battle injures not the man to whom ye heroes grant your gifts.
text.7: may your most recent favour turn to us again come quickly ye who fain would drink.
text.8: come hitherward to drink the juice o ye whose bounties give you joy.
text.9: these offerings are for you these maruts i present go not to any place but this.
text.10: sit on our sacred grass be graciously inclined to give the wealth for which we long.
text.11: to take delight ye maruts friends of all with svāhā in sweet soma juice.
text.12: decking the beauty of their forms in secret the swans with purple backs have flown down hither.
text.13: around me all the company hath settled like joyous heroes glad in our libation.
text.14: maruts the man whose wrath is hard to master he who would slay us ere we think o vasus.
text.15: may he be tangled in the toils of mischief smite ye him down with your most flaming weapon.
text.16: o maruts ye consuming gods enjoy this offering brought for you.
text.17: to help us ye who slay the foe.
text.18: sharers of household sacrifice come maruts stay not far away.
text.19: that ye may help us bounteous ones.
text.20: here selfstrong maruts yea even here ye sages with your sunbright skins.
text.22: tryambaka we worship sweet augmenter of prosperity.
text.23: as from its stem the cucumber so may i be released from death not reft of immortality.
